item.title: David add a quote by Edward O. Wilson
item.description: "One planet, one experiment." -- Edward O. Wilson

item.title: David add a quote by Edward O. Wilson
item.description: "Human nature is deeper and broader than the artificial contrivance of any existing culture." -- Edward O. Wilson

item.title: David add a quote by Robert Wright
item.description: "...human beings are a species splendid in their array of moral equipment, tragic in their propensity to misuse it, and pathetic in their ignorance of the misuse." -- Robert Wright

item.title: David add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: David add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The true measure of a man is not his intelligence or how high he rises in this freak establishment. No, the true measure of a man is this: how quickly can he respond to the needs of others and how much of himself he can give." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: David add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: David add a quote by Michael Connelly
item.description: "There is nothing you can do about the past except keep it there." -- Michael Connelly

item.title: David add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: David add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: David add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Without words, without writing and without books there would be no history, there could be no concept of humanity." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: David add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: David add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Absolute power does not corrupt absolutely, absolute power attracts the corruptible." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: David add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it. " -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: David add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: David add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: David add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: David add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "You're on Earth. There's no cure for that." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: David add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "Every generation loses the Messiah it has failed to deserve." -- Michael Chabon

item.title: David add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: David add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: David add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: David add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: David add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: David add a quote by Thomas Sowell
item.description: "It’s amazing how much panic one honest man can spread among a multitude of hypocrites. " -- Thomas Sowell

item.title: David add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: David add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "For there is but one essential justice which cements society, and one law which establishes this justice. This law is right reason, which is the true rule of all commandments and prohibitions. Whoever neglects this law, whether written or unwritten, is necessarily unjust and wicked." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: David add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: David add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "We read deeply for varied reasons, most of them familiar: that we cannot know enough people profoundly enough; that we need to know ourselves better; that we require knowledge, not just of self and others, but of the way things are. Yet the strongest, most authentic motive for deep reading…is the search for a difficult pleasure." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: David add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "Real reading is a lonely activity." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: David add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "It's called civilization. Women invented it, and every time you men blow it all to bits, we just invent it again." -- Orson Scott Card
